org.openadaptor.thirdparty.json
Class JSONObjectSimpleRecordAccessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.thirdparty.json.JSONObjectSimpleRecordAccessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, ISimpleRecord, ISimpleRecordAccessor
public class JSONObjectSimpleRecordAccessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISimpleRecordAccessor, ISimpleRecord

ISimpleRecordAccessor for JSONObjects. Works for JSONObjects only not JSONArrays.

Method Detail

asSimpleRecord

public ISimpleRecord asSimpleRecord(java.lang.Object record)
                             throws RecordException
Generate an ISimpleRecord representation of the supplied JSONObject.

Note: To get back the underlying Record object, use ISimpleRecord.getRecord()

Specified by:
asSimpleRecord in interface ISimpleRecordAccessor
Parameters:
record - the object to be accessed as an ISimpleRecord
Returns:
a view of the record as an ISimpleRecord.
Throws:
RecordException - if the supplied record cannot be viewed as an ISimpleRecord

Returns:
Class

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
                     throws RecordException
Fetch an attribute using the supplied key value.

The key value might, for example, specify:

  • An attribute name
  • An XPath expression to locate the value within an XML document

Specified by:
get in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - Object which will be used to locate the required attribute
Returns:
the value corresponding to the supplied key. Null if not found or if returned value is null
Throws:
RecordException - if the operation cannot be performed.

put

public java.lang.Object put(java.lang.Object key,
                            java.lang.Object value)
                     throws RecordException
Store an attribute value using the supplied key value.

If the attribute already exists, then it's value should be overwritten with the supplied value.

If the attribute does not exist, then it should be added (if possible) to the record.

The key value might, for example, specify:

  • An attribute name
  • An XPath-like expression to locate the value within an XML document

Specified by:
put in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - Object which will be used to locate the required attribute
value - which is the object which is to be associated with the key.
Returns:
the previous value corresponding to the supplied key, or null if no value was previously bound to the key.
Throws:
RecordException - if the operation cannot be performed.

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
Create a clone of this object.

Specified by:
clone in interface ISimpleRecord
Returns:
clone of this object.

getRecord

public java.lang.Object getRecord()
Return the underlying record object which this accessor is fronting.

for OrderedHashMap implementations, it will return this.

Specified by:
getRecord in interface ISimpleRecord
Returns:
underlying record object which this accessor is fronting.

clear

public void clear()
Clear the underlying Record.

Actual meaning depends on the underlying fronted implementation.

Specified by:
clear in interface ISimpleRecord

remove

public java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object key)
                        throws RecordException
Remove (and return) the attribute from this ISimpleRecord which corresponds to the supplied key.

If the record does not contains any corresponding attribute, then null is returned. If the underlying implementation is a Map, then it should behave exactly as Map.remove().

Specified by:
remove in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - The key associated with the attribute to be removed
Returns:
The attribute associated with the key, or null if there was no value associated or that value was itself null.
Throws:
RecordException - if the operation cannot be performed.

containsKey

public boolean containsKey(java.lang.Object key)
Returns true if this record contains a mapping for the specified key.

More formally, returns true if and only if this map contains at a mapping for a key k such that (key==null ? k==null : key.equals(k)). (There can be at most one such mapping.)

Specified by:
containsKey in interface ISimpleRecord
Parameters:
key - The key to locate within the Record
Returns:
true if this map contains a mapping for the specified
